column4: My phone doesn't automount and I don't know how to manually mount it and can't seem to find any good answers for 12.04 on how to do it, it's recognized as a mass storage device in lsusb but what do I do from there?
are you using udev or no?
I don't think so, not really sure
ok then there are other things that take care of automounting.
I don't even really care if it automounts or not, I just need to get into it to transfer some files, not something I do very often
mount /dev/phonedevicedrive1 /mnt
that's where I'm lost, what /dev/phonedevicedrive1 would it be or how do I find out?
ls /dev |grep sd
whatever ones arent your hard drive is your phone
they are all sda or sdb (I have an external drive plugged in right now, so that's probably sdb)
is your phone set to mountable in the phones os
yes, when I plug it in it asks if I want to just charge or connect to the PC
if I select to just charge then it shows up in lsusb as a modem
connect to pc is usually the phone developers shitty software stuff
select mount as disk drive
I've been able to do it before without using any 3rd party software
you shouldnt need any
select mount as disk drive? in the phone?
yeah
I dont anything like that in the settings anywhere
what os is your phone
that is questionable, it's a Samsung Seek, it runs Java apps, lol
lol good luck.  basically once the phone introduces itself as a drive itll show up in /dev
okay thanks, at least I have some idea of whats wrong now
